headline.print_headline: The Birthplace of Obama the Politician
headline.seo: Roseland, Where Obama the Politician Was Born
headline.main: What Does Obama Really Believe In?

docs.abstract: Sub-prime Chicago neighborhood of Roseland, where a young Barack Obama worked as a community organizer, still suffers from high rates of poverty; neighborhood is a reminder that despite all the actions taken to ease the burden of the poor by the Obama administration, poverty seems to have receded as a national issue; administration says reason for shift in priorities was the economic crisis they inherited.
docs.lead_paragraph: As a young community organizer in Chicago, Barack Obama concluded that to make a real difference, he needed to gain power. But did he actually make a difference?
docs.snippet: As a young community organizer in Chicago, Barack Obama concluded that to make a real difference, he needed to gain power. But did he actually make a difference?

headline.print_headline: Australian High Court Upholds Tobacco Rules
headline.seo: Australian Court Strikes Down Tobacco Challenge
headline.main: Australian Court Strikes Down Tobacco Challenge

docs.abstract: Australia's highest court rules tough new cigarette labeling law does not violate the rights of tobacco companies and will take effect in December; images of ulcers, cancerous lungs and gangrenous limbs will cover three-quarters of the front of all cigarette packages sold in the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: Images of ulcers, cancerous lungs and gangrenous limbs will cover three-quarters of the front of all cigarette packages sold in Australia under a landmark decision by the country’s High Court.
docs.snippet: Images of ulcers, cancerous lungs and gangrenous limbs will cover three-quarters of the front of all cigarette packages sold in Australia under a landmark decision by the country’s High Court.

headline.main: Australia Restricts Company Logos on Cigarette Packs

docs.abstract: Australia's highest court upheld a law that restricts the use of tobacco company logos on cigarette packages.
docs.snippet: Australia's highest court upheld a law that restricts the use of tobacco company logos on cigarette packages.
